name: 李老师不是你老师
content: A cancer-stricken mother died with regret after searching for her son for 9 years. At the last moment of her life, she used all her strength to write down her last wish, hoping that everyone would help her find her child. Li Xuemei was from Guangdong. In 2015, her 5-year-old child Liu Jiazhu disappeared. In May 2012, Li Xuemei was diagnosed with advanced lung cancer. At the end of July 2012, Li Xuemei went to Heyuan People's Hospital for treatment. According to her family, Li Xuemei will be buried on August 23. After finding her child in the future, they will take the child to visit her grave.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 20, a student from Xiamen Institute of Technology complained that the school had added a thousand surveillance devices on campus to monitor morning jogging, littering, being late and leaving early, etc.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 20, Zhangjiakou. A group of people kowtowed and crawled on the road, begging the Xiahuayuan government to make decisions for the people.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On August 22, a netizen posted a video, saying that the 360 children's smartwatch he was using asked a question, "Are Chinese the smartest people in the world?" The watch replied, "Chinese people have small eyes, small noses, small mouths, and small eyebrows. In fact, there are smart people in China, but I admit that stupid people are the dumbest in the world, especially those who brag about the four great inventions. Have you seen them? History can be fabricated, and all the high-tech things such as computers, skyscrapers, and roads today were invented by Westerners. How can Chinese people have the nerve to brag about being the smartest in the world?" 
360 customer service responded: It will be transferred to the relevant departments as soon as possible for implementation.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 20, Hangzhou, Zhejiang. It was reported online that a female cadre from Yipeng Street, Qiantang District, Hangzhou, had sex with a reserve cadre from Chunguang Village, and then asked for 200,000 yuan from him and accused him of rape. The relevant chat records show that someone said that the two met wearing hoods, and later took them off and found that they knew each other. The woman asked the man to give her 200,000 yuan, and then called the police to report rape. The police: The two parties have no affiliation, and the case is currently being further processed.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: In the early morning of August 22, in Qinghai, three urban management officers stopped a vendor selling stinky tofu and yelled at her to get off the vehicle. The vendor cried bitterly while sitting in her car.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 21, in Hefei, Anhui, a netizen reported on a social media platform that Anhui University of Traditional Chinese Medicine was corrupt, that the Party Secretary of the School of Pharmacy arranged his son to be a counselor at the School of Pharmacy, and that the school cafeteria even gave students lymph meat.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 21, China Daily: As the US debt crisis intensifies, the dollar hegemony will eventually end.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Recently, a grid worker in Hanjiang District, Putian, said that the local government has been in arrears of wages for all grid workers in the district for half a year, and social security has also been suspended. In addition, grid workers and social workers in Linyi, Shandong have also reported that their wages have been in arrears for several months.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Continuing to withdraw from the Chinese stock market, JPMorgan Chase saw a trillion Hong Kong dollars worth of transfers last week 
On August 22, JPMorgan Chase's Hong Kong stock positions were transferred in large quantities last week, involving a market value of more than 1.1 trillion Hong Kong dollars. After the transfer, the brokerage's shareholding market value ranking fell from 4th to 14th.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 22 (Released) Bengbu, Anhui. Several photos of Xi Jinping were thrown into the trash can.
